html: In their crime of complacency, the women of God’s people emulate the Woman Babylon, to which spiritual category they belong. Babylon epitomizes a “pampered lady, securely enthroned, thinking to herself, I exist, and other than me there is nothing” ( Isaiah 47:8 ). Like her, they will be compelled to strip bare in their deprivation (cf. Isaiah 47:2–3 ) if they don’t do so now and repent. Lands presently yielding ample produce will turn to “briars and thorns” (qôṣ šāmîr)—literally and figuratively—as enemies invade and the wicked overrun the land (cf. Isaiah 5:5–6; 7:23–25; 34:13; 64:10 ).
